critique: This executive order establishes a committee to coordinate US economic programs and policies in Sub-Saharan Africa with the goal of ending hunger through economic growth, policy reform, and private sector development. It involves multiple federal agencies and departments, operating under the policy direction of the Secretaries of State and the Treasury. The order emphasizes coordination, performance-based aid, and private sector involvement. It does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The focus is on economic development and coordination of existing programs.
